post.title: New blog post
if we have to worship a language, there are probably only two choices that come close - english and german.
there are many reasons that prompt one to think again and again about german language, one example we come across every morning as a normal man - philishave, a great product, how it does it.
drei - that is a very very useful word for our new venture
the reason and need that come back again and again for learning german are its fascinating history, ideas, and will.
it is really to learn 100 german songs, then you are truly on the way to master this language
fest
post.body:
(= hart) solid
⇒ feste Form or Gestalt annehmen (figurative) to take shape
(= stabil) solid
Gewebe, Schuhe tough, sturdy
(business, finance) stable
(= sicher, entschlossen) firm
Plan firm, definite
Stimme steady
⇒ eine feste Meinung von etw haben to have definite views on sth
⇒ etw ist fest(= steht fest) sth is definite
(= kräftig) firm
Schlag hard, heavy
(= nicht locker) tight
Griff firm
(figurative) Schlaf sound

post.title: geschlossen
post.body:
closed
(= vereint) united, unified
⇒ in sich (dative) geschlossen self-contained Mensch, Charakter, well-rounded Buch, Handlung, well-knit Systeme, Produktionskreisläufe, closed
⇒ es war eine geschlossene Wolkendecke vorhanden the sky was completely overcast
⇒ ein geschlossenes Ganzes a unified whole
⇒ geschlossene Gesellschaft closed society(= Fest), private party

post.title: Reihe
post.body:
row
⇒ in Reihen zu (je) drei antreten/marschieren to line up/march in rows of three or in threes
⇒ sich in einer Reihe aufstellen to line up
⇒ sich in die Reihe stellen to join the row
⇒ in einer Reihe stehen to stand in a row or line
⇒ in Reih und Glied antreten to line up in formation
⇒ sie standen in Reih und Glied vor dem Lehrer they stood lined up in front of their teacher
⇒ aus der Reihe tanzen (figurative, informal) to be different(= gegen Konventionen verstoßen), to step out of line
⇒ die Reihen lichten sich (figurative) the ranks are thinning
⇒ in den eigenen Reihen within our/their etc own ranks
⇒ in der vordersten Reihe stehen (figurative) to be in the topmost rank

post.title: Stollen - always starting with its food
i am sure if i learn german the normal way, i will never learn it. so a drastically different way is needed.
it is amazing i have thought about learning german for over 20 years, but still know nothing about it
why baum means a tree?
welt vs world - they see world quite differently
Fahne - german is a very figurative language, much similar to chinese than english, you can get a sense of this from this word's use
post.body: etw auf seine Fahne schreiben (figurative) to take up the cause of sth

post.title: towards not necessarily right but a simple and effective german language for english speaking people
german news
english to german dictionary
inquiry as the first learning method here - we ask questions, hopefully it is answered
so we dedicate this site for the learning of this great language and her people
German language as a value and art
why?
post.body: it is a language of unique value that is distilled from a land, a people nurtured by that land, and has proven itself throughout the centuries. worth some learning.
